title: Matchsafe, "Bollinger Champagne Crate", late 19th century
markings: "Tiffany & Co, Silver-Soldered" stamped on underside of box.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, in the shape of a wooden crate, featuring incised decoration of 2 champagne glasses on front, inscribed "Glass, Keep This Side Up," on top, long side inscribed "Bollinger," on bottom long side, inscribed "Dry Extra Quality," on left side "E. &. J. B., 10.448," on right side incised anchor with "R.B. & C" at center and larger "P." at lower, right-hand corner. Crate has simulated straps wrapped around each end and small incised marks resembling nail-heads on edges of sides. Lid hinged on left side. Striker on underside of box.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Bollinger Champagne Crate", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Plated metal. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-218.
